text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm kirti a Delaware practice
manager with AWS Professional Services
today I'm going to show you how to
launch an Amazon redshift cluster in a
specific Amazon virtual private Cloud
let's get started
you might not be able to select and
access your VPC for the following
reasons the Amazon VPC doesn't exist in
the same AWS region where you are trying
to create your Amazon redshift cluster
in
the VPC isn't associated with the
cluster subnet group
let's see how to launch an Amazon
redshift cluster in your VPC
login to the AWS Management console and
select the desired region
navigate to the VPC dashboard
creative APC by choosing the createvpc
button
giving it a name
and specifying its IP address range
Insider notation
create subnets within the VPC for better
organization and security by choosing
the create subnet button
and providing a name and IP address
range again Insider notation
to create an Amazon redshift cluster
navigate to the Amazon redshift console
in the Amazon redshift dashboard choose
create cluster
and toggle the USD fault switch
in the network and security section
select the VPC that you created earlier
if it's not in the drop down list go
back to the configuration section on the
Amazon redshift dashboard
then create a subnet group with the
subnets of the VPC by choosing create
subnet group
fill in the necessary information for
the subnet group
select the desired subnets from the VPC
and then create the cluster subnet group
go back to the Amazon redshift dashboard
and choose create cluster again
this time your VPC is listed in the drop
down list under Network and security
and now you know how to launch an Amazon
redshift cluster in a specific Amazon
VPC
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
